page.title: 03HOUSING IN HATFIELD
page.content: HATFIELD STARTED AS A SMALL FARMING VILLAGE,BUT WITH THE ADDITION OF A ROYAL HUNTING LODGE,IT GREW IN SIZE TO ACCOMODATE THE SERVANTS OF THE MANOR HOUSE.THE OLDEST HOUSES ARE ALONG THE MAIN ROAD,AND WERE BUILT BY THE MANOR FOR ITS WORKERS.ONE OF THE MOST INTERESTING HOUSES IS THE OLD WORKHOUSE OPPOSITE THE CHURCH (BUILT IN 1711).IT REMAINED AS THE PARISH WORKHOUSE FOR 120 YEARS,UNTIL 1831,WHEN IT WAS CONVERTED INTO TWO HOUSES.MOST OF THE HOUSING IN THE VILLAGE TODAY WAS BUILT AFTER THE SECOND WORLD WAR.THE NEW HOUSING IN HATFIELD ARE MAINLY SEMI-DETATCHED AND DETACHED HOUSES THEY ARE ALL MADE OF BRICK,LOCAL STONE BEING TOO EXPENSIVE TO USE.THE PRICE OF THESE HOUSES RANGE FROM Â£18000 TO Â£35000,DEPENDING ON SIZE AND QUALITY OF THE HOUSING.
